review: A total blast!  FRESH mech designs that offer a pleasingly chunky, WW2-style alternative to the sleek Gundam look.  A huge selection of weapons that are all crazy fun to use.  Challenging but manageable stages with an awesome rogues gallery of enemies & multiple strategic possibilities that make you want to play over and over.  Totally unique story and concept that are executed perfectly.  Co-op support!  Overall: High in the running for best tower defense game ever made.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018469625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1588642714}
review:
I cannot in good faith recommend this game. I got it on sale recently to play it coop with 3 other friends and this game has major design issues to even play the game. Firstly, the game crashes half the time when I tried to change the video settings. Fine, I only need to adjust it once or twice. The other issue is being able to play with my 3 friends, as we have done in all other games on steam without issue. We will take turn hosting the game as the 4th player always get disconnected within 10 seconds of connecting. After we play tag on hosting and can stay in session for a minute or two, we can launch a mission to play. I admit, first 10 missions went smoothly, no lag or shuttering. Unfortunately, this was at 3.5 hours mark of gameplay and this was when things went down hill. At this point forward, any mission we played together, you cannot move from the  lag when a new wave begins. As you know, this is a tower defence game and each mission has an X number of waves. Some waves, we can move after the monsters are already moved to the base. This is just unbelievably poor performance from a game that came out in 2012. 

Steam unfortunately cannot refund me as I exceeded 2 hours of gameplay. But as I mentioned, the issues I encountered was not there until later into the story. We thought maybe one or two waves were poorly designed and would go away, but after a 5th attempt and changing internet providers for one friend, it was just hopeless to continue trying further. 

I hope this review can help someone out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026880725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1697338132}
review:
love this game first played it on the 360.  think of it as a tower defense but you are stomping around the map in a mech.  
there aren't many frames but they are balanced in game play, and there are lots of weapons to put on your "trench" as your mech is called.  This game is great if you have friends playing with you, however if you are playing alone it will lose its appeal very quickly.  The survival missions are a blast and give rewards that you cant get any where else kn the game but you wont get the good loot by yourself. bottom line if you have friends that have the game it is well worth it if not and your going to play alone you will get board quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326216743', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1562109945}

author: {'steamid': '76561198137515792', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1587330973}
review:
Cons:

- Ultrawide resolution has top and bottom of screen cutoff.
- A few minor environmental bugs.
- Sometimes farming certain items can be kind of a pain due to random drop chances.
- Game is priced well, but high enough that it may be difficult convincing a friend to pick it up. Online player pool is mostly dead.
- Some annoying unskippable cutscenes & voice queues.

Pros:

- Lots to unlock even after finishing the main campaign (approx. 10 hours for first playthrough). 
- Infinite replayability through survival gamemodes.
- Incredibly fun, addicting gameplay with lots of polish and complexity. Coming up with a strong defensive strategy and adapting to different maps can be exciting. There are usually at least 3 different loadouts you can take that would easily get you a 3 star for each mission.
- The aesthetics of the game and immersion is top tier. Love the WW2 propaganda look and feel, as well as the stereotypical "war hero" characters. 

I HIGHLY recommend this game to anyone who likes Sanctum 2 who likes the look and feel of this game through the trailers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025802185', 'num_games_owned': 2169, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1586609841}
review:
Iron Brigade est un tower-defense assez basique mais pourtant dÃ©veloppÃ© par Double Fine, qui nous a habituÃ© Ã  des titres bien plus originaux. 
Il n'y a pas grand-chose Ã  retenir de ce jeu ; on s'ennuie beaucoup dÃ©jÃ , la faute Ã  une certaine lenteur et Ã  de nombreux allers-retours Ã  effectuer ou encore Ã  cause d'un cruel manque de renouvellement au fil de l'aventure (hormis les mobs, les modules et les armes finissent trÃ¨s vite par se ressembler les uns les autres) ; l'humour tombe toujours Ã  plat et le jeu n'a mÃªme pas rÃ©ussi Ã  me faire esquisser un seul sourire, lÃ  encore Double Fine nous avait habituÃ© Ã  bien mieux. 
Autant on sent que c'est un tower-defense conÃ§u pour Ãªtre jouÃ© Ã  4, autant je pense qu'il aurait Ã©tÃ© prÃ©fÃ©rable de donner quelques gadgets de plus Ã  ceux qui jouent tout seul afin de leur faciliter la tÃ¢che : encore une fois, aller Ã  l'autre bout de la map pour rÃ©cupÃ©rer des ressources devient vite chiant, encore plus quand on est Ã©quipÃ© d'un mecha relativement lent. 
C'est dommage car le concept Ã©tait lÃ , avec un vrai feeling, la fusion TPS + Tower-Defense aurait pu donner quelque chose de vraiment jouissif et les dÃ©veloppeurs auraient pu aller encore plus loin quant Ã  la personnalisation de notre mÃ©cha. 
Au final, Ã§a se finit en 5 heures (comptez le double pour faire tout le reste) et c'est pas plus mal tant le jeu n'avait dÃ©jÃ  plus grand-chose Ã  proposer. 
J'irais pas jusqu'Ã  dire que c'est un mauvais jeu, mais c'est surtout trop quelconque pour qu'on s'y intÃ©resse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012203940', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 432, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1586434764}
review: Tower defence in salsa steampunk/mech, Iron Brigade Ã¨ un titolo simpatico e tanto vario nella personalizzazione quanto limitato nel gameplay. E' indubbio il fatto che visivamente sia rimasto a quasi due generazioni fa, ma resta comunque godibile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008593922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1648952725}
review: A horde shooter with tower defense mechanics, set in a zany alternate timeline with diesel powered mechs.  Fun and engaging, customization is relevant to how a "mission" plays out.  You progress through an over the top narrative and Campaign. you can redo any mission as you progress through the story- the game uses a hub world mechanic. learning the ropes of what works well together when you build a mech is highly enjoyable. Multiplayer is a bit dead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120338092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1252, 'last_played': 1589332782}
review: The best tower defense third person shooter mech game you never heard of. You pilot a mobile trench and choose whether to become a big assault trench and pack on as much explosives and artillery as you can, or a small nimble engineer trench that deploys dozens of turrets to fight for you. And if your sense of humor finds a man sticking a cigar in his mouth and then lighting it with a handgun good, then you are going to enjoy the bad jokes of this game. Play it with friends for best experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205083425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1948, 'last_played': 1538203320}
review:
Tower Defense, Mecha, and that classic Double-Fine campy humor. What you get here is giant beasts made from twisted wire and cathode ray tube televisions versus a bunch of jovial soldiers stopping the spread of the monivision threat during the cold-war era.

Man your trench solo, or with up to 3 other players in co-op, and collect new weapons, costumes, paints, parts, take on a good dozen levels, and the additional "Survival" modes which offer even greater rewards! 

Theres a great variety of weapons, and balance for the game is quite interesting to say the least, where Enginner-class Trenches (the little guys) specialize in turret placement, and take time, but essentially have no upper limit of power, while large, assault class trenches can slug it out from the get go, but as stronger enemies continue to appear, their usefulness begins to wane. 

But the voice acting, writing, plot, and gameplay all bring in an experience that, while a bit short, is well worth playing, and replaying, and while it has a bit of an 'indie' feel at times, it is a budget title that offers more fun than some triple-A games I have played. 

Replay value is a bit low, with a progressing/leveling system and future weapons being so much stronger than old ones, but its definitely a fun game that is only better with friends. Just watch out for Big Willy!

review:
Good stuff. Do you like Mechs? Customization? Tower Defense games? Strategy? 3rd person perspective? Co-op? This is the game for you. The game is old, the graphics are far from impressive, but it is good fun, the mechanics are just great!

A recommendation, the game does not like you alt-tabbing, if you are someone who enjoys alt-tabbing your games, just un-tick full screen mode in the display options, you should be good to go this way.

review: Awsome game, still good since i last played on xbox 360 in 2011, when u see the games with negative comment, lets just say they can stick it, its an old game it aint gonna be perfect, 9 years, this game is fun, good old TD with a FPS/3rd person shooter element killing tubes, (aliens) with robots (trenches), alot of diffrent combinations from the chasis to legs, to the guns you use, many guns to choose from, machine guns, artiliery shotguns, snipers, this is game is ment for co op but the game is dead, you wont find anyone in the mm, the single player is easy, the only lvls i struggled on where the mars lvlvs, there are groups and discord servers with some active ppl on, so far ive been playing with a mate for 6h of my 7h play time, not 1 problem with connecting to each other, hes American and im Australian yet i see people complain about connection in mp, (maybe its just there internet). friend me if your intresting in playing as im always up for a game

author: {'steamid': '76561197989627304', 'num_games_owned': 547, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1199, 'last_played': 1698612972}
review:
Great game, good engaging singleplayer gameplay, and is a perfect match for some 4 player coop shenanigans.

Its old, sure, but visually still holds up pretty well even now. Performance is great since they ditched GFWL.
If your hoping to just matchmake some coop however, you will be disappointed as the game has very few active online players (judging from matchmaking going on for 30+ min and no hits), so if you are interested in the multiplayer side, make sure your friends grab a copy. Other than that its a fairly solid TD/3PP shootem up,  requiring some strategy later on.

TLDR; Get it for a laugh with mates, or to kill some time here and there solo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101068803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 1762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1405, 'last_played': 1572892417}
review:
Iron-Brigade is a beautiful love story between you and your trencher (mech). Your beautiful bond goes beyond anything the world has seen, with your trusty trencher behind you, you destroy TV monsters and save innocent little children from watching the wrong channel for the rest of their lives. Also something important to note, if you take the pilot Jozef, you'll hear the voice of english sasuke... Thats both good in a weird way, and completely terrifying.

10/10 will kill tv's with friends any day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112208350', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2595, 'last_played': 1583431276}
review:
This is, by far, the best game I have ever played. The game is underplayed, and quite possibly underrated in my honest opinion. The game is so exciting and can get your blood pumping, your mind thinking, and it might just train your mind to think a bit more strategically. There's always the fun of finding the right combination for a specific level or for all the levels, the perfect strategy, how to handle an enemy, etc.

There's a large variety of what can be used on your mech. There are six chassis types, several mech legs - though not many-, machine guns, shotguns, sniper rifles, grenade launchers, artillery cannons, and even "Broadcasters" that are essentially flamethrowers. Some weapons do special things, like the "Mr. Pancake" magnetic MIRV artillery cannon or the "Gungnir" sniper rifle.

This is a game that you have to try before you judge it. I should know, and so should my friend since I bought it for her and she loved it. I should note she stated that games like this "Weren't her type of thing."

author: {'steamid': '76561198000262452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1562384074}
review: Double Fine is one of those studios I really like and respect, and yet I constantly find games by them that I have never heard of before. I got this game on sale and it has been really fun. It's a third person shooter with tower defense elements as  you pilot your giant mech with customizable weapons and turret loadouts as you defend structures from crazy glowing aliens. It's fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064568395', 'num_games_owned': 9682, 'num_reviews': 967, 'playtime_forever': 1015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1015, 'last_played': 1561126172}
review:
[table]
    [tr]
        [th][h1] My Playthrough [/h1][/th]
        [th][url=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLTZKn1hLlcQPk6jhIrH_t8ElCEnMjVFQo] Youtube Playlist [/url][/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td][h1]The Review[/h1][/td]
        [td]Iron Brigade is a game that has an identity crisis. From the look of the game you would assume that it would play like a Mech Warrior game? No this game is a tower defense game. Double Fine seems to believe that they can make a hybrid of both, they think by having multiple types of mech chassis that it can both be action and strategy. That does not work as engineering chassis are the only useful for regular missions while assault chassis is only good for boss fights. So every mission you just drop sentries everywhere and just sit there and wait for the mission to end. The main issue of this game is it is very boring and repetitive. New tube monsters just make it where you use more sentries and does not take much strategy. In conclusion their is no reason to get this when you can get either a pure Mech shooter or a tower defense game.[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

author: {'steamid': '76561198067361801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1372137169}
review:
In Soviet Russia, War Trenches come to you!

This is a nice shooting game about murdering innocent cute TV sets. It has about 6 hours of fun in it. Best played in co-op. The later missions are balanced for at least 2 players, so solo players will have a much more difficult day. The cinematics are also classy.

My advice - grab 2 copies (for you and your bf) when it is on sale. The online community right now (2019) is nowhere to be seen. Otherwise there are better games out there. Overall 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141224781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1370, 'last_played': 1684194800}
review:
Brilliant little TPS/TD game with lovely WW1 art style. It's like playing a cheesy monster movie from 1920-1940.

There's some reports of this game crashing and softlocking the pc up, but I personally haven't experienced any of that.

However, you most likely have to play this game alone. With average daily player count between 10 to 25 you're not likely finding help any time soon, unless you bring a friend with you.

The game is fully beatable alone, but some maps are seemingly designed to have at least two players on it. It can get obnoxious for one player to run all around the map trying to be mister one man army.

That can, however work both ways. There's some good satisfaction on ending a war alone, you know. Friends makes this game much more enjoyable, but playing alone can make you feel like a damn winner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090848906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1317, 'last_played': 1562212600}
review:
One of my favorite games. Played it on Xbox 360 back when it was first released and it was great back then and still is now. You could tell some one this was a current gen game and they might believe you. 
 
That being said... it is very short unless you are a completionist in which case you will find plenty to do. It also lacks many of the options we are used to with modern titles like graphical settings but the game runs smoothly even on my potato pc. 

Final score   3/5   Get in on sale

author: {'steamid': '76561198057378996', 'num_games_owned': 3919, 'num_reviews': 480, 'playtime_forever': 1162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1162, 'last_played': 1559935320}
review: Classic TD game with a twist, you get to control your trench(mech) in order to fight the enemies. Turret placement is free, no grid or blocks to where they would clip to. Enemy types are divided into three groups, first one heads straight to the core, second type attacks your turrets and the last type hunts you down in order to disable you(losing all hit points disables you, QTE to get back into action). It's meant to be played in CO-OP but is not too hard in SP as well, the problem is you can only be 1 "class" where in a CO-OP game you could each play a certain role. Overall a good game, and has plenty of content for the asking price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032768951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1158, 'last_played': 1692171625}
review:
Fun little mech / tower defence mashup 3rd person shooter.

Single player is fun but challenging. Really need to think about it when going solo
Multiplayer is fun as hell and highly recommended
Only downside is it's a *tad* bit short, but there's survival maps and end gear to get, so it's not that bad.

Short game, but very fun. 100% get it if it's on sale, or you know someone to play with.

9.8 / 10 would recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198041911146', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1553846928}
review:
Bonjour,

Je n'ai jouer que peut de temps au jeux car je cherchais de la coop en prio.

Le jeu et bien, les graphique son correct et le style et sympa ^^.

Mais, le grand Mais, c'est que si vous jouer au jeux, attender vous a jouer seul la plus par du temp, oui le multi et assez "casser" vous ne pouvez pas trouver d'autre personne a moin de les ajouter avant.

Le jeux et bien, mais le multi et encore a revoir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009474246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1552906736}
review: The Endgame content seems glitched or something,  I keep unlocking weapons  that are higher tier but I can't seem to get more XP  to be able to equip them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044797961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 7293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7293, 'last_played': 1551699675}
review: A very good mix of First Person Shooter and Tower Defense game. Graphics are cool, but may require a bit excessive hardware to run without crashes. Mechanics are well implemented, specially a very balanced maths. Player must to drive a mech, higly customizable with removable parts and a big weaponry variety that can be adquire by buying, looting, doing missions or getting achievements; even the character dressing is customizable. Also, player can deploy turrets by everywhere by collecting enemy scrap, and there are many types of towers. Retro-futuristic ambience are fine depicted, the plot is fresh and with certain humour sense. Has sufficent kind of foes and they are well designed, maps are very fine developed too. Gameplay is a pleasure, really fun and addtictive. To complete the main mission and 3 survival maps, to collect all possible items with getting 70% of achievements, takes about 100 hours. Is an indie product so unknown as well made, that deserves much more fame. Hopefully the designers do a second part: it isn't necessary to make it better, just more of the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997128755', 'num_games_owned': 1068, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1028, 'last_played': 1422253380}
review:
A weird little gem of a Mech Turret Tower Defense game.

Honestly, check out a trailer as you'll know real fast if you want it or not.
I enjoyed it because it's not about just standing around looking at waves of enemies from a top down perspective. You're right there in the action and can feel like a Hero Character of sorts.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964683253', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1550715731}
review:
So we played Iron Brigade as a 4 player co-op game. It worked pretty well although each time we played there were some kind of problem for at least one of us. Most times, it involved not being able to reconnect after a battle. Not a fatal problem, just annoying, as it seems like all progress was saved but the person who lost the connection just had to exit the game and try again.

Sometimes, we would all get "Internet Connection lost", which was equally annoying and again, not a big problem, because we would all just reconnect. We tried different people hosting the game (luckily, this wasn't a problem) but it never ran 100% smoothly.

The graphics were a bit on the simple side and a little weird. Not really sure what the story was about - fighting "tubes" I guess. A "tower defense" game, where we all got our own kind of Mech-like things to attack the nicely varied kinds of things moving in on us. There were a few interesting tactical choices and in general was pretty fun to play.

It was, as usual, far too easy though. After the first couple of maps, where we were just trying to figure out what was going on, we only had to replay a map once. So, once again, I really wish it were more difficult. As far as I could tell, there was no way to up the difficulty. We like a challenge and I would have liked to have to replay a map, trying new tactics, in order to win. I am *not* going to replay a map just to get a better grade on it!

There were plenty of options to customize your mech, although 3 of us ended up with the same basic type. I went with the small, more mobile on, that could deploy "Heavy" emplacements. In the end, there could have been more things to customize it with, but in the end, there was just enough.

I liked that anyone could go the the "Radio Room" and invite the other players. And I liked looking at the other mechs. I would have liked to have a "test range" so we could check out how the various guns and emplacements worked. So I would give it a solid "B". Definitely one of the best co-op tower defense games, probably even better than Sanctum 2, which was fun but sometimes only one player really had anything to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393178995', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1847, 'last_played': 1684996078}
review:
This game is very fun CO-OP tower defense game I played it quite a bit back in the Xbox 360 day and had to purchase it a second time to replay it with friends. Although it can be hard to connect to friends at times once you all get into a lobby it is a ton of fun whether you are playing the story mode or trying to get as far as possible in the endless wave defense modes. This game has quite a bit of different weapons and chassis so you can build your mech up to your liking and playstyle. Overall, this game is a great game to play whether you are doing Co-op of solo play, however it is so much more fun when played with friends. This game is also very relaxing but also can get very tense and serious.

Dispite the connectivity issues I still fully recommend this game whether you are wanting to play it with a buddy or solo. 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198014577920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1626648182}
review:
A great blast from the past for me, as I used to play this on the Xbox. Iron Brigade is tower defense done right, supporting a variety of different playstyles as well as challenging players to change up thier builds to tackle some of the unique challenges in each level. The game truly shines, however, when you experience it with three of your friends, each of you armed to the teeth in your unique trenches piloted by your customized pilots, and your whole brigade dives headfirst into an absolute scrapstorm.

10/10 Would spam Gungnir again

author: {'steamid': '76561197972040704', 'num_games_owned': 1835, 'num_reviews': 724, 'playtime_forever': 1404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1374, 'last_played': 1508200454}
review:
I want to recommend this game, but I'd be remiss if I did. This is a port of a console game and its DLC. It's a tower defense of sorts, in which you run around in a mech/walking tank, shooting robots. You get scrap which you can use to purchase and upgrade towers, and you are awarded cash which you can use to buy upgraded weapons, armor, etc. to kick more ro-butt. The game has a set number of missions with boss battles at the end of each fairly short campaign (three campaigns in the main game and one in the DLC), and there are a few little brief quasi-cutscenes. The story is nothing to get excited over. I love the premise of the game, and at times, I had fun. The fact you can play it in up to 4-player co-op is great as well. However, the game had some serious issues for me.

Lag was horrendous. I can host Tom Clancy Wildlands, Dying Light, Borderlands 2, all sorts of stuff that's far more advanced than Iron Brigade, and even games with more players in them simultaneously than this. However, the game frequently slowed to a crawl, rarely becoming a slide show...no exaggeration. When it got really bad, my friend would disconnect. To be fair, he also has some computer problems, but this game is an absolute resource hog. He could run many newer games just fine, but this one chewed at his processor and sometimes overheated his feeble PC. My computer is just dandy, though, and it still suffered awful lag while playing this game online.

Another issue I had was unskippable cutscenes mid-level. When you're trying to get through an annoying boss or lengthy map and a cutscene starts up that you can't skip, it's pretty dang annoying to me. If that's not an issue for you, then that's good! I got pretty peeved by it.

You know how in most TDs you either automatically get upgrade currency mid-battle, or its auto-deposited for you after a wave? Or hey, in some TDs, you just quickly swish you mouse over coins on the ground. Well, in Iron Brigade, you have to physically run your mech within range of whatever you blew up and hold a suction button to draw in the resources. This is time-consuming and the resources disappear quite quickly! The only alternative is to spend the resources to purchase a magnet to suck them in...and even then, its range is rather tiny, and the bots might attack and destroy those towers, thus wasting the precious resources you built them to gather in the first place!

When they brought this game to PC, I believe they should have implemented better design (for PC resources), better online play quality, automatic resource/scrap-obtaining when blowing up bots (and get rid of the magnet towers, naturally, or just have one at the base that pulls in across the whole map but it costs a lot), and allow cutscenes to be skipped. These issues made the game pretty insufferable at times, and turned what should have been a great time into an occasionally decent time at best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027440626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2523, 'last_played': 1535859077}
review: Super fun! But it would be nice to be able to DELETE a turret -w-

author: {'steamid': '76561197960303714', 'num_games_owned': 600, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1528143220}
review:
I really like tower defense/TPS games like "Orcs Must Die!" or "Sanctum". But unlike those two examples Iron Brigade has one game mechanic which totally killed the fun for me:

Killed enemies drop the game currency on the spot and you have to collect it. 

That doesn't sound like a big deal but it gets annoying when you kill enemies all over the map e.g. with sniper weapons to get ahead of the wave. So this results in a lot of running with a clunky mech and even losing a lot of resources if you are too slow.

To be fair the rest of the game is pretty well made and people who don't mind that will have a lot of fun with this game.
But for me I can't recommend buying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008883618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 5046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3547, 'last_played': 1674874017}
review:
How is this game less known than Psychonauts? It's just as fun, humorous and creative as the other. I have played this years ago, and played it again this year and it is STILL fun. 

Get it, unlike most the games they make now, this one will last and has great customization for replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167788463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1136, 'last_played': 1602046681}
review:
Great game, Although the multiplayer hasnt worked in a long time from what i can gather... My friend and i try for hours, only to end up giving up and playing solo... cheers to all the cash it must still be raking in calling its self a multiplayer... would be cool to join and play together.

 Do not buy the multi bundle four pack. at least till they fix the networking so players may join thier friends

author: {'steamid': '76561198161872296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1602045831}
review: Bought this game for a few of my friends, was friggen amazing when I had it on x-box. Loved it. Single player works great, but cant connect to my friends, endless loading screen. Checked the support page and it's been going on since 2015. Pretty bummed out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198849289268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3689, 'last_played': 1561855919}
review: A great game with a lot of strategy involved that always keep me coming back. I found myself extremely addicted to this game when I first got into it so its really great to see its available here on steam. The only complaints I have is that the servers can have quite a bit of lag and disconnections especially in 3 or 4 player games and I don't know if that falls on the servers not being dedicated as old of a game as it is or if its the connection between players thats the problem. It's the only downside to a really great game you just have to be willing to deal with it until you find yourself in a match that has a better connection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352491946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1535087153}
review:
TL; DR - If you dig some comedy filled burst gaming that doesn't pull you down for hours, then go fort his hidden gem in a heartbeat.
9/10
Story - 6/10 
A lighthearted , corny 1970's sci fi story that is actually shorter than the loading times for the game.  But then again, if you play TD games for the story, you are in the wrong place.
Gameplay - 9/10 
Extreme variety with a multitude of enemy types and turret placements, frequent drops that don't punish you and force the grinding , and FREE LOOT BOXES . 
Video/Audio - 7/10 
Actually surprised with how well the clunky movements of the protaganist gels with the overall comedic theme of the series. They have the game with 4X aliasing as well so you can ramp your graphics to make it look the las stand of Zion in the Matrix.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015746884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1537646343}
review:
i was looking for a coop game to play whit friends and got this on sale this weekend. 

"iron brigade" is a tower defence/shooter mashup much like "orcs must die" in a ironic kind off first world war setup.
its definitly fun to play in coop mode and also alone but i must say that the game is much harder if you play alone. 

you are a soldier sitting in a mobile trench (a oldschool mech) whit lot of guns which you can upgrade and customise between missions (change gun/emplacement setup) and u can put down emplacements (towers whit guns, buffs and debuffs) on the battlefield. most of the time you have to defend objects and the enemies will attack you on different routes  whit ground and air units aiming at the object, you or your towers (depending on enemy)

i liked the game so far, its definitly fun as a short game to play whit friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988437395', 'num_games_owned': 1388, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 11858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11293, 'last_played': 1544791329}
review:
Iron brigade is a "lost era" of PC gaming chunk of gold.

Strap on your way back when helmets since this is going to get bumpy.
Looooooong before lootcrates, MT's in everything and $59,99 1/3rd games being the standard, there was Iron Brigade.
Originally developed for XBLA (xbox live arcade) it was shortly thereafter ported to the Personal Computer for Windows Ex Pee and Veesta.

It was a massive success for a game that wasn't tied to a huge multiple-A budget and provided many of us with a fresh and engaging coop experience revolving around an alternate WWI setting where mechs and aliens were very real things.

The gameplay is simple enough at first but gets challenging pretty fast.
It sets you off on earth where you're informed that earth is under attack by an evil mad person and only you and 3 other people can stop him/it.

You do said things by securing pieces of the warmap such as locations in each continent, strategical locations elsewhere and space.

Doing so requires a few things. A pilot (you & friends), A giant stompy warmachine of your choosing and stationary defenses to deter (read: riddle with bullets) whatever is on the opposing side.

Normally i go on and on about how good this game is but in this case, it wasn't for two reasons.
1: GFWL. (Yuck. I know)
2: A bug that made longer game sessions unplayable.

As of 2015, said bugs (both) have been removed and the latter was caused by the former. Naturally everyone moved on by this point but that shouldn't have happened to begin with.

As of writing this review, you too can own a very underrated Mech/TD hybrid for the ever so low price of <$2,50, which is practically stealing it.

You won't find open lobby games practically at all, but some die hard people like me still play from time to time and do pre-made coop sessions, so the game is still somewhat alive if anything.

Worth your time? You decide. It was worth my entire playtime combined and i can't stress how badly this game needs a sequel.

7/10. Troubled past, Great future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971022916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 15452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1688057436}
review:
Jolly Good Fun!

If you have friends and you play computer games together, this is one to add to the library!

It's funny. You have mechs that you outfit with crazy guns and you drop in for an all out frag-fest against hordes of enemies. What more can you want?

author: {'steamid': '76561198279848929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1532706438}
review: Meh. It isn't horrible. I had some fun, but I would never recommend this game to anyone. If you don't mind staggeringly mediocre graphics, slightly buggy controls, unskippable and repetative cut scenes, levels design that makes it hard to get a clear picture of what is going on then you can still have some shooty fun with this game. Only buy it on deep discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012884147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3169, 'last_played': 1708533171}
review:
Iron Brigade is a mech combat game set in an alternate version of the 1940s. Essentially, if WWII was fought between human mechs and sentient TV monsters, it would be this game. Start the game with a basic mech and work your way up to building more and better mech designs; As your mech improves, take on harder missions. You also earn turrets you can lay down on the battlefield, so the game is as much about passive tower defense as it is about you doing the shooting yourself. Some mech parts can only be collected by random drops, so collecting them all involves grinding a particular mission until you get what you're looking for (this includes getting high scores on the survival missions).

I know from playing the XBox version of this that multiplayer play is a lot of fun, and the difficulty scale is about right for the number of players (the game is slightly harder overall with more people). However, I've never actually been able to play the PC version in multiplayer mode; The game has longstanding problems with multiplayer support, and it is still not fixed, in spite of the developer's claims otherwise. This is also one of the few DoubleFine games to have never seen a Linux port (although it mostly works on WINE).

I love mech games for the same reason I love survival games: elements of both action and strategy blended well together. You have to plan out what kinds of parts to equip and where to put your turrets, but you also have to pilot your mech and keep up with the incoming enemy waves. I've beaten every mission many times, collected every non-multiplayer achievement, and I still enjoy this game. Iron Brigade makes my short list of (3) Windows-only games I highly recommend in spite of my general avoidance of the platform... I only wish the developers would give Iron Brigade some more technical TLC so I can finally play with my friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979223944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1533364959}
review: I played Iron Brigade back on the Xbox when it first came out (back when it had a different name even :P) and was thrilled to see it available on steam, and on a ridiculously good sale at time of writing. If you've every enjoyed an FPS Tower Defense game before, you'll almost certainly enjoy this one, as it's still one of the best in the genre. If you've never played FPS TD but like regular tower defense, this is a great introduction to the niche as it has one of the best stories in any tower defense game and great gameplay. If you're not usually a fan of tower defense...you probably won't enjoy this one, but if you have any inkling to try the genre out again the Mobile Brigade can always use more recruits! :P. Fantastic story, great gameplay, pretty good graphics (not 4K fidelity, but it looks good), and it's dirt cheap right now. Give it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198224122680', 'num_games_owned': 723, 'num_reviews': 567, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1531950681}
review:
Pretty well crafted dieselpunk third person shooter, that unfortunately turns really boring in single player mode.

Play this with a friend, and I am sure, you'll have the best experience. Alone it's just not that fun, even though all the mechanics are in place and working. The overall aesthetic and presentation is commandable and adds a lot to the gameplay.

Unfortunately since the enemies can come from any direction it's hard to prepare for them in single player town and upgrading a turret is just so rare that it barely happens during overly long missions. When you are alone, you're just running around hoping to collect everything with barely enough time to do any base building, it's hectic, but also really frustrating. The artifical limitation on turrets is quite bad, even though I really liked the customization options.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000543293', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4899, 'last_played': 1529286259}
review:
Tl;dr: Iron Brigade is a cheesy, dieselpunk themed, cooperative tower defense game. The only problems with it are slightly dated menus and a low player count.

Behind this is a very playful, tongue-in-cheek style of humour that strives for "Rated 'M' for 'MANLY'" in a dieselpunk world changed by the coming of cable television, and enormous mechanized walkers - the Mobile Trenches.

"Turn no-mans-land into REAL-MANS-LAND!"

You get to pilot one of the afor-mentioned walkers, taking to the field personally to defend objectives against terrors of screens, wires and other components besides to prevent the CRT-based 'Tubes' from conquering the world. Your walker can be personalized with a variety of interesting, fun, and sometimes downright wacky weaponry and abilities that lets you dominate the field. From small, fast ranging scouts, to lumbering mobile turrets, you are not defenseless in the least, and can take the fight to the Tubes, up close and personal!

You don't have to do this alone, however - as you have a slew of towers at your disposal to aid you. Initially you can only field a limited number and type of towers. As you upgrade your walker, and customize it to your liking, more towers and tower types become available. The variety and selection of these towers ranges from the usual suspects of sentry guns, to more unorthodox jammers, snipers and explosive barrel deployers. Creative use of these towers is key to success, and is as much fun to find and devise unique combinations for even more destruction.

Being a coop focused game, other players are welcome and recommended - as each player can only field a certain number and variety of towers. More players means more options, and more potential for deadly traps to be established. Not only that, extra walkers means extra guns, and sometimes that can be the difference between success and defeat.

Being an older release, support (now) is naturally lacking as far as new content - and while it doesn't lose it's charm, it can become repeatative. A small community, and sometimes sketchy online compatibility also means the biggest strength - the coop - is a little hard to come by. This is especially troublesome with later maps, which all but require a full teams' worth of firepower to complete.

In all, I love this game, and I think it's a shame the community isn't as active now as it was on release through Xbox Live. That being said, if you and some friends love some campy tower-defense, give this a shot and you shouldn't go wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198408671944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 3132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3006, 'last_played': 1708942591}
review:
This game is fine, double fine.  If you like the aesthetic you might also like Fortified.  Both games have a similar sensibilities and each game has their own set of problems.  Iâ€™m not a huge fan of third person tower defense games.  They feel like an exercise in true masochism. 

I picked up Iron Brigade for $1.50.  In principle I got my moneyâ€™s worth.  Iâ€™ve owned it twice on XBL and Steam.  If you paid more than that, you were robbed.  IB is cute in a steampunk inspired WWI mech sort of way. It supports 4-player co-op though it feels mechanically unbalanced. 

Your loot drops are dependent on your player level and the map youâ€™re actually playing on.  I disagree with the former and have no issue with the latter.  I resent unlocking gear that Iâ€™m too low level to use.  The art style is quite charming to my 10 year old self.  

Itâ€™s pulp-inspired U.S Vs. Russia 1940s style sci-fi tower defense and if you couldnâ€™t grind to level up your mech Iâ€™d say that Fortified was the better game all round.  Games that follow the pulp-hero-shooter formula are fairly hit or miss, more so misses than hits if they also happen to be TDs or RLs.  

The maps look very washed out and almost grungy and the objectives do feel a little bland and very samey as you progress even if the level design is moderately interesting to look at.  As you progress the waves gain variety, they get tougher, the number of waves and the number of enemies increase the more go on. 

The boss maps are interesting though grading your performance on how fast you can kill a giant tentacle is very lacking in imagination and even more so in execution. When Iron Brigade players grow up they realize that Sanctum 2 is just an all-round better game. Thatâ€™s an objectively verifiable fact. 

If youâ€™re one of those hardcore die-hard people who play every tower defense under the sun, youâ€™ve probably already got this game and if you donâ€™t have it by now, you donâ€™t need it.  Itâ€™s alright though IB decided to set up shop in an already crowded market place and they have only themselves to be blame. 

It feels like one of the Double Fine development team just saw Sanctum and decided to rip it off, dumb it down and make it third person because those dumb scene kids will buy anything.  Itâ€™s ok. Itâ€™s not a must own the way Sanctum 2 or Killing Floor 2 or Orcs Must Die 2 might be for some.  

You get a lot of ammo, and a lot of turrets, though I donâ€™t recommend playing Iron Brigade solo.  Itâ€™s not that good. It becomes needlessly hard and feels very unsatisfying after about two-thirds of the way in.  It doesnâ€™t bring anything new or exciting to the genre.  Get Sanctum 2 or Orcs Must Die 2 instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279987087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1608, 'last_played': 1632201888}
review: still a great game and yes ppl still play it!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198263427469', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1525881765}
review:
Originally made for consoles game lacks of important features for being played comfortably.

First impressions were positive. There are nice intro comics, voice acting and unique setting. But the game itself is... not fun.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1381830605
Some scientist got crazy and wanted to destroy all the world. Funny, he is Russian. But.. brave Americans won't to afford it. So they sent a huge battleship with innovative a mech to fight against the aliens.

This game plays as Orc Must die. You have a character with basic attacks and you can build towers. But... Orcs must die is more fun in my opinion.

So, enemies come, you kill them with the mech, gathering cash and sometimes place towers. An idea is very nice.. but it plays not fun. Big maps, the mech is low and can't jump, you need to always move to gather cash. You can't see enemy health, so you are just shooting and hoping it will be dead soon.

After missions, you get new weapons and new towers.
I finished 5 missions and didn't want to continue the game. It is just not fun

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1381830670
Pros
- An interesting setting, story and intro comics

Cons
- No difficulty settings. The levels are long, simple and boring
- No info about enemy health. No tactics. Just run and shoot
- Incredibly bad mechanic of gathering cash.
- Awful UI. I got stuck  several times because I didn't know what the game wanted me to do to start the next level
- the game was originally made for consoles. It lacks of depth in the gameplay.
- Levels are huge and were designed to be played in co-op. But noone plays this game right now.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1381830649
[h1]Resume[/h1]
The game could be great but there are a lack of important features, like difficulty settings, call fast wave and etc. It have low TD options and it is mostly an action game.. Also, it relies on co-op gameplay, but nobody plays it right now. I can't recommend this game in 2018.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029909284', 'num_games_owned': 655, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 1095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1095, 'last_played': 1526150834}
review:
Good co-op Mech game that is unfortunately because it isn't optimized. 50% of the time you'll get framing on the screen even with beefy hardware.

Main Positive - Good Co-op game
Main Negative - Optimization sucks

Note:- Old game, no longer supported, pickup only on Steam sale (e.g. 4 play with buddies)

Good
- Good artwork
- Mechanized MECHS (called Trenches)
- Humour
- Best played Co-op, solo play would get boring fast

Bad
- Not well optmized, slow down even on beefy hardware during co-op gameplay
- The interface is confusing
- Repetitive
- Old game, no longer supported therefore no more optimization support. This was a XBOX 360 game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101168910', 'num_games_owned': 431, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 4817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2905, 'last_played': 1604235015}
review: Game has decent ideas and fun gameplays. Sadly is not a single player game. The 15$ price tag should be the cost for a two pack. Later levels have huge map sizes with enemies that grant invulnerablity to all surrounding enemies and they bury themselves inside the waves. Only way for these enemies to die is for the player to physically force in between the enemies to kill them. Map sizes can mean it's unfeasible to play solo. Also the store page is atrocious. It give no info on what the gam eis about and the main reason why I didn't pick this game up for years. A non recommend unless you have friends or enjoy unwinnable situations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289791316', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1271, 'last_played': 1524793300}
review:
-I wished there was a "Meh" option for the recommendation because that's what i really think of it-
fun little game but not good enough to try to get invested in it:

Pros:
-campaign is decently fun
-decent tower defence/action mix
-concept of trenches and it's customization is fun
-fun weapons
-game's writing, animations and quirks can give a few giggles
-dlc is included
-variety of enemies with unique function to each to deal with

Cons:
-completely empty multiplayer (unless you have a friend playing it and available)
-short lived (obviously)
-the Jacobs (enemy unit that make every other units around it invincinble until killed, will explain in the survival mode section why it is a travesty)
-survival mode (defend the base until it's destroyed vs infinite horde, each 5 turns finished gives a loot) has a very limited map choice: 
-1st decent map 
-2nd harder decent map
-3rd horrible map

and your run will always end because you'll get to a turn where they will spam the jacobs, meaning a guaranteed loss of every towers (there's camouflaged towers that enemies can't attack... but they're not enough to survive) and sudden complete destruction of the base's (or bases') health. (obviously can maybe be dealt with by changing your build, but then what is the point of trying to have fun if you have to switch from a build you have fun with to a boring one?)

-since survival mode is the obvious time sinker of this game, it's enjoyment can be set back by a whole lot, making the game boring very quickly
-there's Brutal Legend items, but they're crazy expansive, like maybe a few-days worth of constantly grinding money expensive (survival mode gives no money btw)

author: {'steamid': '76561198077985588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1521834402}
review:
I'm not good at reviewing things, I ramble on about every little thing I can think of, and I don't have a very organized way of doing it, so I'll try to just sum things up. I love this game, I really do. It's fun to set up defenses, and roam around to shoot where you don't have any because you don't have the scrap to built any turrets. It's hectic, and fun.

This is what I thought of the gameseveral months ago when I last played it. Everything was fun to do, worked as intended, and I found myself coming back over, and over again. However, just recently, minutes before I wrote this review, my feelings are very different. For some damn reason when I booted up the game, and started playing, my turrets started to go apeshit. I have no clue if there's an issue with my install of the game, or if changes were made since I last played, but turrets practically do nothing, so I'm, losing missions left, and right, because I'm literally the only one doing the work. 

Turrets just randomly work, or don't, I've had cases where a turret will fire a single shot at something it couldn't possibly see yet, then freeze up, and the opposite, where something standing right in front of it doesn't trigger it to fire at all. I replayed the first mission of the game, and I almost lost, when I remember breezing through it fairly well. The turrets are broken, I don't know how, or why, but they flat out do not work anymore, so the game hase become unplayable, and unwinnable. 

I'm recommending the game because when I initially played it, it was fantastic, and I still love it. It's just the fact that the turrets do basically nothing anymore, so I have not been able to complete a single mission past when I last played. I can't say with any certainty of this is an issue exclusive to my install of the game through some error, or if this is an update that broke them, so I'm stuck just leaving this review as a sort of heads up for the creators if they still work on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119391591', 'num_games_owned': 973, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1577991443}
review:
A raw gem forgotten in time... *sigh*

Alternative history where those blue TV freaks appeared and WW1 turned in a survival game.
But hey, it's not all gray... except that humanity is close to extinction... on the bright side, MOBILE TRENCHES! *yeeyyy*

Those badass 'murican style mech are the core of this game. 
You use one of those to shoot the , you guessed, the enemy. *giggle*
Cannons, MGs, Snipers, Grenade launchers, shotguns, Flak ... did i miss anything?
Also Turrets, but those are secundary, at least for me they are more of a support, considering they can be destroyed.

Alas, the player base is so low that you can consider it a dead game. à²¥_à²¥
also, singleplayer is a bit hard, proceed with caution.

i rate it 8/10    i enjoyed it before it appeared on steam, if you can find a friend to buy it with you, you are set for some good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144128683', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1593591667}
review: Iron Brigade is an action and strategy game of the tower defense genre with command centered in an armed and armored walking mech. The enemy is the Broadcast, a horde of wonderfully creepy monsters, including some challenging bosses, led by a nicely accented fanatic that present a range of difficulties. Players can invest in defense units while also charging in with the mech to take on problems directly. There are multiple mechs unlocked through the course of the game along with dozens of different weapons and resources to equip them. The levels are varied with considerations to be taken into account of flow and vertical space plus natural hazards. Although the best approach is to put time into turrets and the mech the mechanics are balanced enough to allow total specialization in either and still succeed. The game makes no attempts to innovate but the polish, design, and balance makes it a solid and appealing work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096478582', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1518138205}
review:
This is a seriously good game that I have really enjoyed for the time I've been playing. (8 hours.) 

What this game has to offer: Riding a robot as the screenshots show. Enemies come at you, and you shoot them with guns you can customize. You can change the legs of your "Trench" including the chassis so you can put on different types of weapons, which are ranked in power by 1 to 3 slots. If a weapon has 1 slot, you can equip 3 of them on one side, if your chassis even allows you to. You also have different types of objects to place down, going from regular guns, to explosives, to healing or collecting scraps. What types of placements you can use, and how many of a specific type you can use, is dependent on your chassis. You have specific points to defend, of course. You have customizable clothing as well, so you can look any way you want in battle. You can play up to, I think either 4 or 5 people and there are different characters to choose from to play as. 

Problems: Well, honestly, I haven't really found any. 

My personal problems: The game keeps giving you weapons or clothing items one or two levels above the current level your at. This has been somewhat frustrating as I dont want to keep getting things I can't already use/wear. 

This next problem for me is also a bit of spoilers:

On the level right before Mars, (or technically the first level in the "Mars" section) the difficulty goes up a lot. The enemies have significantly more health than they did before, and I have failed on the first Mars mission 4 times. The paths they take to the points I have to defend are rather annoying, as well... and the worst part is, I have like 7 turrets defending one point and they haven't succeeded in doing anything but fuck all. 

So yeah, you should buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041636869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 1174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1174, 'last_played': 1517699576}
review:
A tower defense game mixed with a third-person shooter, where you play as a soldier piloting a World War I style mech. Itâ€™s a strange game. Itâ€™s also a fun game, but not without its flaws. It can get a little bit grindy at times when you are looking to find the right equipment and you are rewarded with money that becomes completely pointless by the middle of the game. There are also a few maps that are clearly designed to be played by more than one person, making it frustrating in single-player. 

That said, I would love a sequel to this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256643172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1516209951}
review:
Even today, seven years later, Iron Brigade is fun and exciting, and the weirdest thing is that it still holds up visually. 

The relative small campaign and cheesy, playful story put aside, this game remains as intriguing and tense as any good toward defense in the market. 

What really sticks up like a sore thumb is misleading special effects of components of your mech like the main body and a relative poorness on scaling anything more than hp numbers as the game grows near it's end. 

That been said of course, Iron Brigade takes home two budges, one of hour for your buck and another for tension filled experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027894996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1046, 'last_played': 1515807329}
review:
This was a fun little treasure for mech fans, and fans of quirky alternate timelines like of the ilk of Crimson Skies. In fact it feels like the world of Crimson Skies after a transmission game that changed everything, and through such the USA was re united, and world affairs came back into order between said transmission and WWII.

Now I'm often not one for Towar defense, but this game is a chunk of that, and honestly probably one of the first to do it well, and it stands up to this day. If you like that sort, you'll be at home here. If not, you still might find this is the game that makes it worth your while.

Gun shots feel meaty, a good audio effect to boot if something blasts too close to you and your hearing comes swiming back in slowly after the puckerd sounds die away. Few have done it better. Meanwhile the torrent of bullets, blasts of buckshot, sniper cannons, and said defening artillery all make you feel something when you pump it into the enemy as you stomp along in your fortified trench location mobilized by mechanized legs. After all this game was once called. TRENCHED back on the xbox 360, but for some odd reason the name had to be changed. I should look up why some day soon.

Wondering where the DLC for this game is? Why, it's included in your one time purchase these days! The adventure will continue into new frontiers you wouldn't expect the moment you thought you rid the Earth of the tube menace, the interesting threat born of mad science and the unknown is one you need not feel bad about thrashing, and there will be many varriants you will run into in your ventures that you'll be ushered across by a sailing and stomping aircraft carrier which will also be your lobby for you, friends, and others who still play the game to this day. But indeed if you have three friends, consider picking up the four pack.

Also survival mode seems to be all the rage these days. SO, you got that too! And it'll unlock new and un usual loot you may not find else where. Weapons and other goodies for you to enjoy. Even unlock some new looks for your Trench pilot by leveling up your rank through experience. I'm currently sporting an air tight suit with a gas mask, looking like I'm part of the Death Korps of Krieg.

If you like a lil bit of comedy with your monster smashing, and otherwise stomping around mechanized machines with massive guns and cannons, there's little reason for you to NOT try this game. The venture spans a good chunk of time with plenty of unlocks through a fun game of blowing up threats to mankind. Whatch your guns open, lock down with fresh ammo, and line up with your friends to deliver the next salvo of difference making booms.Even your quick dropable gun and tool emplacements will add to the fury and customizations along with the options in trech legs, chasis, and varried weapons and paint jobs to be unlocked. Unload upon the foes with your friends, in your own particular style of blowing up and stomping the TUBE creatures for the bettermant of Earth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013867802', 'num_games_owned': 1335, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1515078595}
review:
Decent enough version of Orcs Must Die, set in an alt history with mechs and aliens. Let down by some unfortunate problems, you can't sell turrets, often things go poorly explained. Probably a lot more fun if you have a few friends to play with.

I'd give it 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023491401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1537259698}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025025894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 2638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1576503660}
review:
Picked this up for myself and a few frinds while on sale and it's a solid pick for Friday Night gaming with the crew. 

Lot's of replayability, contant unlocks and many rewards/different maps. Customizing your Trench/Mech is a fun process even though the UI is pretty clunky at times. 

If you see this on sale - snag it quick. It's a great tower defense game with a mech/wwi influence. DoubleFine charm shines through everywhere. 

If it's at full price, still consider this if these kinda games are your thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973490373', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1514831419}
review: Some fun weapons, on paper, but ultimately they don't have the powerful feel you'd hope from a shoulder mounted artillery cannon. Found myself finishing a 20 min. mission, get a new weapon that I had to try, launch another 20 min. mission, unlock more stuff to try. I had to pull myself out of that loop after beating 5 missions and unlocking my favorite weapon types. But even then, enemies just aren't that fun shoot. Progression be damned.

As we speak I am upgrading my expensive network of turrets across the battlefield and your broadcast is being traced right now so you better prepare for the storm, monovision. The storm that wipes out the pathetic little thing you call your Big Willie. Youâ€™re scrappin dead, tube. I can be anywhere, anytime with my hot pants, and I can kill you in over seven hundred ways, and thatâ€™s just with my turret emplacements. Not only am I extensively trained in various comedic gestures and salutes, but I have access to the entire arsenal of the USS Mckinley and I will use it to its full extent to wipe your miserable monovision menace off the face of the continents of Europe, [spoiler] Africa, and in the Pacific, maybe the planet Mars if I am feeling frisky[/spoiler], you little piece of scrap. If only you could have known what [b]Iron Retribution[/b] your little â€œcleverâ€ broadcast was about to bring down upon you, maybe you would have disabled your pylons. But you couldnâ€™t, you didnâ€™t, and now youâ€™re paying the price, you blasted monovision. I will spam [b]Turret Fury[/b] all over you and you will drown in it. Youâ€™re scrappin dead, scrappo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042245004', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1623384792}
review:
I wish they would remake this game. Keep the campy story style and the corny weaponry. And keep the simple enjoyable gameplay. Just make it bigger and more complex in terms of strategy. Multiplayer only maps could be massive and wonderfully complicated. Also having the enemies not have a set path would make games much more tactical. 

Anyway, this game as-is is allot of fun. The multiplayer has some glitches where you can be randomly disconnected from each other. But overall it is allot of fun. Replayability is exceptionally high. I play this frequently on both PC and Xbox 360 (mostly I play it on Xbox because it seems to work better.) 

A bit overpriced now that it is getting long in the tooth but still a great game. 

Please make a new version of this game!!! Doublefine...please??

author: {'steamid': '76561198151579756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1099, 'last_played': 1537896926}
review:
Retro looking, simple commands, and yet, i cant stop running around killing damm monos.

Its a great tower defense / mobile trench game. 

Pros: - great for Co-Op 
         - allot, and i mean allot of weapons to choose from. 
         - Superb visuals and sound
         - Challenging game, and with survival mode, its even better
         - Replay and replay and replay

Cons : - Short Storyline
           - Hard to find people to play with thru the game, better add them on Steam and then match with them

Final Result : From 0 o 10  = an 7+  Thumbs up game. Cant wait for Iron Brigade 2

Enjoy Guys and Girls, and if this review helped you in any way please leave me a Thumbs up or Down, i would appreciate it immensely.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994123345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1504672850}
review:
Got this game because I love tower defense hybrid games (Orcs Must Die and Sanctum series, Deathtrap, etc.).

Iron Brigade isn't awful, but it is nowhere near as polished as those other games I mentioned.  Controls are clunky, unskippable cutscenes drag down the tempo/flow of the game, and the game is hardlocked to 30 fps.  

To top it off, I only got to play about 30 minutes before the mouse completely stopped working in game.  I can see and move the cursor fine in menus, but the buttons don't work and the mouse doesn't do anything at all once past the menus.  I scoured the internet and there are only a hanful of support posts about a mouse not working, and they're all related to Games for Windows, which is not used in this version as far as I can tell. 

So, basically I got to play 30 minutes of a mediocre game and now I can't play at all.  Thumbs down.

::: Edit - turns out you need to disable the Steam overlay for this game.  This doesn't change my overall neagative review though.  It might be worth it if you can catch a sale for 80% off for a price of $3.  However, $15 is a joke and you should give this one a pass :::

author: {'steamid': '76561198027934177', 'num_games_owned': 2199, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1504392202}
review:
This game is pretty good as far as tower defense games goes. It's not great, just good. It has a slow, boring, start that makes most people likely quit. A friend and I tried it out and it took us maybe two hours to get into it. It has so many avoidable issues, bad designs, that makes the game less user friendly and a tad overwhelming. Because there is so much thrown at you, the game has a very bad first impression. 

The game allows you to customize your mech, in this game called a "Trench," customizing its core (body) that then allows you what emblacements (defense towers) in varrying types and quantities in trade off for various weapons sizes and quantities. You are able to pick from a healthy enough variety of weapons and can pick some really powerful weapons if you so choose to sacrifice emplacement options for it. You also can choose the legs of the "Trench" which gives varrying abilities that will accomodate some playstyles. 

There is not an overwhelming large variety of emplacements, there is maybe slightly more than ten. However, like the weapons, there is different variants of each emplacements from quality of weapons. For example, there is "advanced" versions of weapons or emplacements that need to be unlocked through progression (such as leveling up and earning money) to purchase it through the store the game has or getting it by chance in the so very common loot crates.

The weapons uses an inventory system which means if you want two of a weapon on your mech.... you need to own two. Some things however have no need to have multiple variants of, such as emplacements or cores, but you seem to be able to get them anyways which is always disappointing if you get them from loot drops. Also a negative point, the store makes it difficult for you to know what you already have, meaning you need to exist the store menu and check inventory just to be sure. 

The story is mediocre, it's not bad but not good, but it gets the job done. The story is more of an excuse for the gameplay, which is just fine considering many tower defense games, including Dungeon Defenders, do. The gameplay allows players to have more emphasis on emplacements or gun combat, something I think is a good design choice. The enemies are diverse and create many challenges I am sure in the late game that will need good team coordination. However, as of right now, the game is very easy and has virtually no challenges. 

The game has a bronze, silver, gold, grading system that grades you based on time. I am sure this will generate mild replay value, some gold scores being overwhelmingly low compared to our bronze finish which hints we are suppose to come back later with very good "trench" mechs. If it can keep our attention long enough for that, I am sure we will appreciate the something to do. I do think that such a system is bad design, nothing is more fun than playing with overwhelmingly powerful mechs on lower levels to complete trivial tasks just to finish a grade for your gold collection.


The game is far from perfect, I would argue it deserves a 7/10. It's enjoyable, just not for the default price. I am very glad I got it in a bundle long ago. Get it for under $10 with some friends, only then would I say it's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277625631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1507357966}
review:
Bought this during the summer sale and it is turning out to be one of the best games that I bought.  It is a FPS Tower Defense game that puts you in the controls of a Trench which is just a mech. You fight agianst robot enemies created by a devious russian sicentist.  
The game play is really fun.  Running around shooting protecting your objetives.  You are able to build and upgrade towers during combat.  The controls are very intuitive and easy to pick up. I play on a controller by the way.  The mech mechanics are well thought out and add some strategy to the game. There are different types of cores.  Standard. Engineer, and Assault calss.  Based on those cores you have so many weapon slots and so many tower slots.   This is important depending on what kind of mission you are going on.  Your weapons are divided into left and right fire, this leads to you coming up with combinations of weapons for each side.  Like on one side you can have all machine guns, and on the other you can have a grenade launcher and a shotgun firing at the same time.    The levels are challenging but not infuriating.  You will havea good time and play them again trying hard to get your gold medals.
The one downside to this game is that not enough peopl play it.  I need to get my friends on this because it would be a blast to play with others. But currently I haven't gotten matched a player yet. I'll keep trying. Buy this game its worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030345683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1228, 'last_played': 1447550881}
review:
A fun TPS stompy "Robot" tower defense game with a neat and amusing alternate interwar/post-WWI theme and a number of customization options for your Mobile Trench (stompy robot) that allow for a number of ways to tackle each mission.  Best played with others, though still fun solo; just don't expect to be able to kit your trench to your liking all that often due to having to fulfill mission necessities by your lonesome.

On a side note for anyone who's read older reviews, this game used to have memory leak issues (primarily during multiplayer iirc).  Said issue is no longer present (barring bad luck).

author: {'steamid': '76561198139675984', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1509849833}
review:
>Be me
>Basement dweller during steam summer sale
>Come acros a game called "Iron Brigade"
>Thought it was a flash tower defense game
>Bought it for $1.50
>Had to climb out of my parents' basement to rob a bank for the money
>Got the money, made a daring escape by jumping off of the bank roof
>Quadruple chins protected my face from the fall
>Tip fedora at authorities as I drive off in my parents' car
>Get caught by police
>Go to jail
>Die in jail, after slipping on dropped soap
TL;DR:
10/10 game, would buy at full price.

Nonetheless, I got hooked until I "beat" it and had tried out all the fancy weapons.

review:
WW1 trenches on mecha legs, piloted by a whole bunch of manly men, running around putting up Tower Defence style towers.
 
To fight television. 

As in actual, evil mutant TVs, trying to take over the entire world. With their evil TV powers.
 
Honestly? Do you really need to hear more than that to know if this gameâ€™s for you or not?
